title: That Crazy Talk About Robert Mueller
description: And then they came for Robert Mueller.

title: Manaforts Spending Fails to Impress in Wealthy Enclaves
description: WASHINGTON  Look closely enough, and the document charging Paul Manafort with money laundering, tax evasion and foreign lobbying reads less like a 12-count federal indictment and more like the ultimate spendthrift whodunit. It is the kind of tab that could raise the Botoxed eyebrows of Beverly Hills, New York and Washington, all places where dizzying displays of wealth are not abnormal but instead usually the price of admission.

title: White House Chief of Staffs Civil War Remarks Elicit an Angry Response
description: John F. Kellys suggestion that "compromise could have stopped the Civil War touched off an angry debate on Tuesday about the meaning of the conflict that served as the latest reminder that the 1860s was not the only time of political polarization in the countrys history.

title: Mangled School Bus, Bodies Everywhere in Manhattan; It Was Surreal
description: The screams seemed too vivid from the start, too visceral to belong to crowds celebrating a crisp and sunny Halloween in Lower Manhattan. The tragedy had unfolded in just minutes, and for hours and hours it remained too senseless to believe.

title: Andrew Weissmann, Muellers Legal Pit Bull
description: WASHINGTON  The target was a New York City titan  plain-spoken but Teflon, irresistible to the tabloids and insistent upon loyalty from his associates.

title: Top NPR Editor Accused of Sexual Harassment While at The New York Times
description: NPR has placed a top editor on leave after allegations emerged on Tuesday that he had sexually harassed multiple women while at The New York Times.

title: Russia Inquiry Fails to Unite a Nation
description: On Valentines Day in 2001, the heads of the major television news networks went to Capitol Hill to answer hard questions about the poor job they had done on Election Day.

title: Quotation of the Day: Legal Pit Bull Who Fought Mob Is Unleashed in Mueller Inquiry
description: Frankly, I cant think of two people who deserve each other more than Andrew Weissmann and Donald Trump.

title: Constitutional Convention: Thanks, but No Thanks
description: That the mechanisms of New York State governance require serious repair is beyond dispute.

title: Lunchbox Snacks
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Everyone have a glass of milk ready? Thanks to Herre Schouwerwou, we have a tasty snack in our puzzle today. Were just going to have to find it.

title: Inside Russias Network of Bots and Trolls
description: How do bots and trolls work to infiltrate social media platforms and influence U.S. elections? We take a closer look at these insidious online pests to explain how they work.

title: Corrections: November 1, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Sayfullo Saipov, the Suspect in the New York Terror Attack, and His Past
description: Sayfullo Saipovs arrival in the United States in 2010 began unceremoniously in Ohio.

title: At Halloween Parade, a Thinner Crowd and a Tense Environment
description: There are fewer sounds more defiant than beating drums.

title: Whats the Economic Cost of Brexit? Pineapples Tell a Tale
description: SITTINGBOURNE, England  Britain is increasingly grappling with the bewildering economic consequences of its pending departure from the European Union. For one company, Nims Fruit Crisps, the impact is measured in the soaring cost of pineapple.

title: Philip Murphy, in His Own Words
description: The Times asked Philip D. Murphy, the Democratic candidate for governor of New Jersey, to fill in the blanks in a letter to New Jerseyans.

title: With a Rally and a Romp, Dodgers Top Astros and Force Game 7
description: LOS ANGELES  The home run was quintessential Joc Pederson  a high-arcing parabola that drifted and drifted, carrying into the first row of the left-field pavilion at Dodger Stadium. As home runs go, it was pedestrian.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: H Is for Hawk and Total Divas
description: The Pursuit of Happyness arrives on Netflix. And the writer Helen Macdonald trains a hawk in the English woods.

title: New York, Catalonia, Paul Manafort: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Word + Quiz: pith
Extending Grace
description: This is an illustration that went with a recent article by The Timess Sketch Guy, Carl Richards. In this context, grace means kindness.

title: The Unseen Julia Child
description: While Julia Child was capturing France through its cuisine, it was that same French magic that inspired her husband, Paul, to capture the country through photography.

title: Teaching Activities for: Opioids on the Quad
description: Before reading the article:

title: The Unseen Julia Child
description: The Parisian sun casting a warm glow on a balcony overlooking narrow streets, laundry drying overhead. The bustle of a market. Sprawling Provenal vineyards.

title: Beatrice Fihn Thinks We Can Abolish Nuclear Arms
description: Congratulations on your Nobel Peace Prize! How did you become interested in nuclear disarmament? Ive always been interested in international issues. But as with many people who grew up after the Cold War, nuclear weapons didnt feel relevant. I interned for a Swedish feminist peace organization called Womens International League for Peace and Freedom in Geneva. I got thrown into these big U.N. meetings where Russia and the U.S. and China debated nuclear weapons, and I was completely fascinated because it was so bizarre.

title: Can I Turn In a Bad Fraternity at My Sons College?
description: My son is on his college football team. Most of the football team is in a fraternity known for its boorishness; it prides itself on disparaging other frats and behaving badly. My son wisely chose not to join it, opting instead for a fraternity that appears to be serious about teaching ethical behavior to its members.

title: Big Music in Small Rooms: Throat Singing
description: Experience an intimate show of Inuit throat singing from Tanya Tagaq and Laakkuluk Williamson Bathory in Iqaluit, on the edge of the Canadian Arctic. Ms. Tagaq will perform at Carnegie Hall on Sunday, Nov. 5.

title: Where the STEM Jobs Are (and Where They Arent)
description: The national priority in education can be summed up in a four-letter acronym: STEM. And thats understandable. A countrys proficiency in science, technology, engineering and mathematics is vital in generating economic growth, advancing scientific innovation and creating good jobs.

title: What Colleges Want in an Applicant (Everything)
description: The admissions process is out of whack. Just ask the heartbroken applicant, rejected by her dream school. Ask high school counselors, who complain that colleges dont reward promising students for their creativity, determination or service to others. Even the gatekeepers at some famous institutions acknowledge, quietly, that the selection system is broken.

title: Not the Bots We Were Looking For
description: In 2016, restless tech-industry forecasters enjoyed a rare moment of consensus: Whatever else might be coming next, everyone seemed to agree that bots would be a big part of it. The analyst Benedict Evans, in a representative essay, located a promising future specifically in chat bots  conversational interfaces for artificial intelligence, designed to assist with particular tasks. Facebook, the year before, created a personal-assistant chat bot, and the company would soon open its Messenger app up to outside developers, who it hoped would create more bots to help people shop, look things up or otherwise organize their lives. Amazons Echo, by then already a surprise mainstream success, provided a tailwind: Here was a widely used artificial intelligence just sitting there on millions of countertops.

title: Are Political Memes Dangerous to Democracy?
description: Are you a fan of political memes? In the 2016 election, did you create, view or share them? Were there any you found particularly smart, funny or disturbing? What do like or not like about these kinds of memes?

title: I Hear Shes a Real Bitch: A Swaggering, Feminist Restaurant Memoir
description: I HEAR SHES A REAL BITCH By Jen Agg Illustrated. 355 pp. Penguin Books. Paper, $17.

title: Yes, Breitbart News Has a Fashion Critic
description: John Binder has a bone to pick with his fellow fashion chroniclers. Mostly their attitude is you can be with us, but you have to believe all the things that we believe, he said. If you dont, youre just not chic enough for us.

title: A Post-Obama Democratic Party in Search of Itself
description: On Nov. 9, 2016, about 12 hours after Hillary Clinton conceded defeat to Donald Trump, Nancy Pelosi, the House minority leader, convened a conference call with her fellow House Democrats. Most of them were still back home in their respective districts and still in shock. Not only would Trump be president, but the Senate remained in G.O.P. control, and  despite rosy predictions from Pelosi and her partys pollsters  so did the House.

title: House Intelligence Committee Releases Incendiary Russian Social Media Ads
description: Facebook, Google and Twitter were on Capitol Hill on Wednesday after a hearing a day earlier, this time to face questions from the Senate and House intelligence committees.

title: Goodnight Moon, but Not Just Yet
description: WINDOWS Written by Julia Denos. Illustrated by E. B. Goodale. 32 pp. Candlewick. $15.99. (Picture book; ages 3-7)

title: James Madisons Zigzag Path
description: THE THREE LIVES OF JAMES MADISON By Noah Feldman Illustrated. 773 pp. Random House. $35.

title: The Upside of Being Ruled by the Five Tech Giants
description: The tech giants are too big. But what if thats not so bad?

title: Frank Stellas Favorite Cities for Art
description: The American artist Frank Stella, 81, best known for his Minimalist and abstract styles, will tell you that, without travel, he wouldnt have been able to sustain his career as long as he has. Seeing great art in different destinations gives me the motivation to keep going and holds me to a high standard professionally, he said.

title: 5 Shows to See if Youre in New York in November
description: New Yorkers are infamous for regarding their city as the center of the universe and, on especially self-satisfied days, as the only place to be. This citys theater artists, though, know that big things happen in small and out-of-the-way places. Consider some of the new productions opening this month.

title: The Tear-Stained Confessions of Sam Smith
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  This is a mostly complete inventory of the times that sweet, sad Sam Smith cried over the course of two hours on a couch here at the Chateau Marmont hotel on a recent Friday morning: He cried when he talked about the house he grew up in; when he reminisced about a crush who turned on him; when he talked about his first voice teacher. He cried when he talked about writing Pray, a song from his new album, The Thrill of It All. He cried when he talked about the children he met in Mosul, Iraq, on a recent humanitarian mission, and then he looked down at the sparrow tattoo he got on his arm when he returned home, with Be good, be kind written in Arabic beneath it, and he cried again. He cried talking about how much he cried when he watched the movie Inside Out. And he cried when he talked about love. When he talked about love, he leaned back on the couch with his limbs splayed and looked upward as if he died momentarily just considering a concept so big.

title: How I Rolled on the Crescent: New York to New Orleans by Rail
description: Everyone I told said the same thing: Oh, my God! Ive always wanted to do that!

title: Living in ... Greenwich Village
description: Luxury buildings are rising where artists and rebels once lived, but the Village still has more culture and history than just about any other part of the city.

title: Greenwich Village: Once Offbeat, Now Upscale
description: Greenwich Village residents past and present always want to tell you about their first apartment there. Seventy dollars a month, can you believe it? crowed a friend the other day, reminiscing about the studio with the tiny bathroom under the eaves of a crumbling brownstone he rented in the 60s.

title: Colbert Slams Kellys Explanation of the Civil War
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: 10 Things to Know About Getting Into Your Dream College
description: Theres no magic formula for getting into a selective college, but over a decade covering admissions for The Chronicle of Higher Education, Ive picked up a thing or two. These takeaways, based on hundreds of interviews with admissions deans over the years, may help you navigate the process.

title: Greta Gerwigs Radical Confidence
description: Greta Gerwig once peed her pants during a math test. She was in seventh grade, it was a new school, the test was a placement exam and she didnt know the rules. Was she allowed to get up? Was it O.K. to raise her hand? While she agonized, the girl next to her noticed the puddle forming. Gerwig has forgotten this child Samaritans name, but she will never forget what the girl did. She took off her sweatshirt and whispered to Gerwig to tie it around her waist and go to the nurses office. Gerwig  terrified, humiliated  did as instructed. The next year, when Mrs. Jensen, her social-studies teacher, asked the class for submissions to a school literary journal, Gerwig wrote a story about a girl who pees her pants in class. Mrs. Jensen loved it so much that she hung it on the board.

title: An Alaska Senator Wants to Fight Climate Change and Drill for Oil, Too
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Lisa Murkowski was unequivocal when asked recently about rising global temperatures: Climate change is real, the Alaska Republican told an audience in Anchorage.

title: Who Won the Reformation?
description: The Western world has not known quite what to do with the 500th anniversary of the Protestant Reformation. The powerful Protestant establishments that would have once celebrated the quincentenary wholeheartedly are mostly weak or impotent or gone, and while the disreputable sort of Calvinist and the disreputable sort of Catholic still brawl online, in official ecclesiastical circles the rule is to speak of the Reformation in regretful tones, like children following a bad divorce who hope that now that many years have passed the divided family can come together for a holiday, or at least an ecumenical communion service.

title: America Is Not a Center-Right Nation
description: The Democratic Party has learned to stop worrying and love big government liberalism. The partys top presidential prospects are advertising their ardor for socialized medicine, free public college, universal child care and paid family leave.

title: Just Say No to Opioids? Ads Could Actually Make Things Worse
description: In declaring the opioid epidemic a public health emergency last week, President Trump promised that the federal government would start a massive advertising campaign to get people, especially children, not to want to take drugs in the first place. But past efforts to prevent substance abuse through advertising have often been ineffective or even harmful.

title: New York City, Russia, Los Angeles Dodgers: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Australia to Ban Climbing on Uluru, a Site Sacred to Indigenous People
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Visitors to Uluru, a giant sandstone slab jutting from the central Australian desert, have for decades ignored a sign at the rocks base that politely reads: Please dont climb.

title: Tapping Into Dementia Patients Memories Through Vaudeville
description: The elderly dementia patient in the next room was unresponsive and in a foul mood, the head nurse warned. Dapper Dan and Beatrice took that information into account and proceeded anyway.

title: Running a Marathon? Think Hot Tub, Not Ice Bath, Afterward
description: Muscles recover better after exhausting exercise if they are warmed than if they are chilled, a helpful new study finds.

title: Listen to The Daily: Muellers Strategy, and an Attack in New York
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: New York Today: A Terror Attack in Manhattan
description: Good morning on this drab Wednesday.

title: Remembering 8 Lives Lost in the Manhattan Truck Attack
description: A mother of two from Belgium who had come to New York with her mother and two sisters. A young computer scientist from Manhattan. A financial worker from New Jersey. And 10 Argentine men in New York to celebrate their 30th high school reunion. Together they shared a bustling bicycle path along the Hudson River in Manhattan on a brisk, sunny Tuesday afternoon.

title: Tech Executives Head Back to Capitol Hill: DealBook Briefing
description: Good Wednesday morning from Andrew Ross Sorkin in New York and Michael J. de la Merced and Amie Tsang in London. Were watching for the fallout from Emerson Electrics $28 billion takeover bid for Rockwell Automation, one of the biggest merger offers of the year so far. (And were still waiting on the Houses tax bill, obviously.) More on that in a minute.

title: Sonys Fortunes Improve, From Rising Profit to a Return for Aibo
description: TOKYO  Sonys robot dog is getting a new lease on life. A decade after discontinuing Aibo, Sony said on Wednesday that it was bringing the mechanical canine back as an experiment in cuddly, consumer-friendly artificial intelligence.

title: A.C.L.U. Sues Trump Administration Over Detention of 10-Year-Old Immigrant
description: The American Civil Liberties Union sued the Trump administration on Tuesday over its detention of a 10-year-old girl with cerebral palsy who was stopped by Border Patrol agents in Texas last week on her way to surgery.

title: Trump Declares Suspect Should Get Death Penalty
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump touched off a sharply partisan debate over some of the most divisive issues in American life on Wednesday as he cited this weeks terrorist attack in New York to advance his agenda on immigration and national security while assailing Democrats for endangering the country.

title: Trumps Official Portrait Resembles a Smiley Emoji
description: It was an irony lost perhaps only on the White House that, almost nine months after he entered office, President Trumps official photographic portrait was finally released  on Halloween.

title: New York Times Co. Reports Solid Digital Growth as Print Slides
description: The New York Times Company continued its march toward a digital future in the third quarter of 2017, as strong growth in digital advertising and new online subscriptions helped counteract a further collapse in print advertising.

title: Navy Collisions That Killed 17 Sailors Were Avoidable, Official Inquiry Says
description: WASHINGTON  Two collisions between Navy destroyers and commercial vessels in the Western Pacific earlier this year were avoidable and the result of a string of crew and basic navigational errors, the Navys top officer said in reports made public on Wednesday.

title: California Today: A Story of Loss and Community in a Little Almond Tree
description: Good morning.

title: Hidden Treasures of Nazis Art Dealer Finally Go on Display
description: Weeks after a German magazine tipped off the world that an 80-year-old man had hoarded hundreds of artworks collected by his father during the Nazi era in a Munich apartment, the world gasped at the prospect of rediscovering long-lost treasures.

title: The Illustrated Interview: William Wegman
description: The artist William Wegman, who has a new book, Being Human, out now, and an exhibition, Before/On/After: William Wegman and California Conceptualism, coming to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in January, sketched his answers at his New York studio with a fine-point Sharpie.

title: From Hurricanes to Protest Movements, Food Is a Way In
description: Ive been writing about food since the late 1990s, when the food editor at The San Francisco Chronicle lured me to California for a new beat that combined food and traditional news reporting. I was happy to give up what had been a steady diet of crime stories, City Hall meetings and feature editing.

title: Where to Relax (and What to Eat) in Formentera
description: The southernmost Balearic Island, Formentera  a 12-mile-long, low-lying piney stretch that was abandoned because of the Black Plague in the 14th century and resettled only 300-odd years later  has long been known for its superlative beaches and water thats striped so many shades of blue it looks tie-dyed. Bob Dylan and Jimi Hendrix are said to have spent time on the island in the 1960s, and Pink Floyd visited in 1967. Today, glitter-painted tourists often day-trip from Ibiza, a 35-minute ferry ride away.

title: What You Get for $450,000
description: A Craftsman-style home in Great Barrington, an energy-efficient house in Tulsa and a 1948 ranch near Lake Michigan.

title: $450,000 Homes in Massachusetts, Oklahoma and Wisconsin
description: WHAT A shingled home, circa 1900, with three bedrooms and two bathrooms

title: Suspect in Japan Serial-Killer Case Sought Out Suicidal People
description: TOKYO  Over the summer, the man told his father that his life had no meaning. Then he went looking for others who felt the same way, and apparently killed them.

title: Another Game 7 Provides a Perfect Ending for the Astros
description: LOS ANGELES  Justin Verlander had played in two World Series before this fall and both were typical of their era. One was filled with errors and lasted five games. The other was a four-game sweep.

title: The Dossier Freakout
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Paul Ryan Is Choking On His Own Mystery Meat
description: House Republicans were supposed to unveil their tax proposal today, but it has been put off  and not, as you might imagine, because theyre a bit worried that their grand opening might be overshadowed by the indictment of Trumps campaign manager and sworn testimony of collusion between campaign officials and Russia.

title: Spoiler Alert: Great British Bake Off Winner Is Named (on Twitter)
description: LONDON  The current season of the much-loved amateur baking show The Great British Bake Off came to an end on British television last night, in a finale that rose to the occasion.

description: This unit on the 17th floor of a 20-story condominium is on the market for about $1.34 million.

title: A Stylus That Works for Tablet and Wallet
description: Q. What is the difference between a $100 tablet stylus compared with a $10 model?

title: The Exterminating Angel Brings Together Opera and the Movies
description: The Metropolitan Opera has looked to other artistic disciplines for shots of energy in recent years. This has mostly taken the form of invitations to directors from Broadway (Bartlett Sher), dance (Mark Morris), art (William Kentridge) and film (Anthony Minghella).

title: How to Be a Smart Obamacare Shopper
description: The best strategy depends on how much you earn.

title: Broadways Comic Chameleon Writes a Heartfelt New Tune
description: Judging only from his manly industrial-pop score for The Full Monty, whose opening number is called Scrap and sounds like it, I first imagined David Yazbek as a roadhouse rocker wielding a working-class ax.

title: Read the Navy Reports on the Fitzgerald and McCain Destroyer Collisions
description: Two collisions between Navy destroyers and commercial vessels in the Pacific this year were avoidable and the result of a string of crew and basic navigational errors, the Navys top officer said in new reports.

title: China Blinks on South Korea, Making Nice After a Year of Hostilities
description: BEIJING  For more than a year, China has railed against South Korea, calling for boycotts of its products over Seouls decision to let the United States deploy an antimissile system, which Beijing fears threatens its own security.

title: Trump Loves Fox & Friends. Heres Why.
description: While other major news networks were focused on major news, Fox was looking elsewhere.

title: For This Playwright, Africa With Laughter, Not Tears
description: A year ago, the actress and playwright Jocelyn Bioh decided to write a play about African characters  a searing play, a brutal play, a play that theaters would finally produce. I was going to write the poverty porn,  she said. The play about African suffering.

title: Whats Your Thanksgiving Story?
description: So many people take part in this American holiday, yet its unique to everyone. And so wed love your personal snapshot of the day.

title: Police Officer Ryan Nash Ended New York Rampage With 9 Bullets
description: Sayfullo Saipov sped a rented truck down nearly a mile of a Hudson River bike path on Tuesday afternoon, killing eight people and injuring 12 more, before crashing in front of Stuyvesant High School in TriBeCa.

title: Moulin Rouge! The Musical to Open in Boston With Broadway Hopes
description: A stage musical adaptation of Moulin Rouge, Baz Luhrmanns lush dreamscape film that infused a 19th-century love story with contemporary pop music, will get a first production in Boston next summer.

title: Sticking to the J Train, but Learning to Reroute Dark Thoughts
description: Navigating the city is a thrill for Ramel Paredes. He is well-versed in the interconnectedness of New York Citys subway system, always knowing which routes are the most expeditious to get to his Brooklyn home.

title: The Best Midweek Chicken Parm
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: A Dodger Steps Back as Fans Deliver Their Own World Series Justice
description: LOS ANGELES  As the boos rained down on Yuli Gurriel in Game 6 of the World Series on Tuesday night, Rich Hill walked slowly around the mound at Dodger Stadium. He fidgeted, he stretched, he went up the mound and back down again. Even for a pitcher who deliberately alters his pace to mess with the timing of opposing hitters, this was obviously different.

title: Bette Midler Hosts Her Hulaween Benefit in a (Gasp!) Cathedral
description: Certain rules apply when youre hosting a benefit at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine. Cursing is not allowed. And nudity, it should go without saying, isnt either.

title: Robert Mueller Will Never Get to the Bottom of Russias Meddling
description: The first indictments in Robert Muellers investigation into Russias interference in the 2016 American presidential elections have made it very clear that Russia-gate will be a critical factor in American domestic politics in the months to come. But no matter how deep Mr. Mueller digs and what he finds, it seems unlikely that he is going to get to the bottom of a series of bigger questions about the Kremlins decision to interfere in Americas politics in the first place.

title: The Roots Black Thought on Philadelphia Style. And His Beard.
description: Tariq Trotter, 44, a founder of the music collective the Roots (and the house band for The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon), could be hip-hops Dostoyevsky. Like the Russian novelist, Mr. Trotter (also known as Black Thought) has refined literary fire from the soulful furnace of pain and suffering.

title: Math Problem Bedevils Republican Tax Rewrite
description: WASHINGTON  There is a math problem at the heart of the Republican Partys protracted introduction of a sprawling tax bill, and it grows, in part, from President Trumps two nonnegotiable demands.

title: Prosecutors Describe Drivers Plan to Kill in Manhattan Terror Attack
description: Federal prosecutors on Wednesday filed charges accusing the driver in the Manhattan truck attack of carrying out a long-planned plot, spurred by Islamic State propaganda videos, to kill people celebrating Halloween.

title: Unspeakable Pursues Uneatable, Fashion Follows
description: Because I spend a lot of my time writing about fashion, people sometimes question me about my personal style. If I have one at all, it has probably altered very little since I was 10. Back then I was taught to believe that clothes should be of good quality, simple and unobtrusive, practical and hard wearing, and that shoes should be the best you can reasonably afford.

title: When This Sea Slug Eats, It Prefers the Turducken of the Sea
description: Youre camping in the woods, about to tuck into some salmon youve caught when a bear appears. Its waiting for you to eat your fish, so it can swoop in to eat you.

title: Law & Order True Crime Season 1, Episode 6: The Sons Speak
description: As I write, this weeks episode of The Menendez Murders has come to an end, the 11 oclock local news has just begun, and the coverage is dominated by the terrorist attack in downtown Manhattan. And as my colleagues and their subjects try to sift the facts of what happened from hearsay, their conversations return inevitably to motive  Why did this person do this?  and, sometimes, despondence  How can any person do this?

title: New York Attack Turns Focus to Central Asian Militancy
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The terrorist attack in New York on Tuesday was carried out by a young man from Central Asia, a former backyard of the Soviet Union known for poverty, isolation and repressive governments  all elements in breeding some of the most militant Islamist activity in the world.

title: Hartford Student Charged After Boasting About Contaminating Roommates Belongings
description: A student at the University of Hartford in Connecticut was charged with criminal mischief and expelled from school after boasting about having contaminated her roommates toothbrush, face lotion and other belongings in an effort to drive her from the room.

title: Airstrike Kills at Least 25 at Market in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  An airstrike at a busy street market in northern Yemen has killed at least 25 civilians and wounded at least nine, Yemeni health officials said on Wednesday.

title: Panic. Then Vote.
description: Did you hear the bugs are disappearing? Amateur entomologists tracking insect populations in Western Europe discovered that, at a number of survey sites, the biomass of flying insects caught in their traps fell by almost 80 percent between 1989 and 2014. For whatever reason, in a media landscape thick with catastrophe, this was the story that cut through for me in this moment. Flying insects pollinate our plants, including crops. They are food for birds and bats and frogs and things. If the almost-80 percent decline proves true, and bears out globally, and continues unabated, we may all starve to death long before Donald Trump has the chance to vaporize us in a nuclear holocaust.

title: Michael Oreskes Quits NPR Amid Sexual Harassment Accusations
description: Michael Oreskes, who led NPRs news division and was formerly a high-ranking editor at The New York Times, resigned on Wednesday after being accused of sexually harassing women.

title: Manhattan Attack Is Called Terrorism. What About Vegas?
description: Hours after a truck plowed along a Manhattan bike path on Tuesday, Americans returned to a debate that has become a vessel for some of the most contentious questions dividing an increasingly polarized society: When is an attack terrorism?

title: Did Facebook Really Need a Safety Check in New York?
description: Early on Tuesday evening, as a terrorist attack in Lower Manhattan dominated the news, millions of Facebook users were notified about a Violent Incident in Manhattan, New York.

title: Muhal Richard Abrams, 87, Individualistic Pianist and Composer, Is Dead
description: Muhal Richard Abrams, the autodidactic pianist, composer and educator who was known both for his diverse, unclassifiable compositions and improvisations and for establishing and sustaining the influential Association for the Advancement of Creative Musicians, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Voices Grow Louder for Merger of Womens Pro Hockey Leagues
description: BOSTON  Members of Canadas national womens hockey team believe the answer is clear. So do their rivals on the United States roster.

title: Walter Isaacsons Leonardo da Vinci Is the Portrait of a Real Renaissance Man
description: Because Walter Isaacson has made a cottage industry of writing about Renaissance men, its no surprise, really, that hes finally landed on a subject from the actual Renaissance. Like the other idols in Isaacsons gallery of polymaths and visionaries  Albert Einstein, Benjamin Franklin, Steve Jobs  Leonardo da Vinci was born with extra bundles of receptors, attuned to frequencies his peers could not hear and capable of making connections no one else could see, especially between the sciences and the humanities.

title: The Gravelle Geardown (Wonkish)
description: A lot, indeed most, of the action in the current tax fight will involve corporate taxes. And these are, unfortunately, a nasty, tricksy subject. In particular, right-wingers can appeal to a simple story that sounds right until you pay closer attention.

title: Ride-Hailing Apps Free Pakistani Women From Abuse, if They Can Pay
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  Dont look at a woman over and over again in your rearview mirror. Dont make comments about the way they dress. Dont ask them if theyre married.

title: Buildings Across U.S. to Light Up Orange for Las Vegas Shooting Victims
description: From a soaring skyscraper to the wide span of a bridge, landmarks and buildings around the world are often called upon as torchbearers of grief after mass tragedies.

title: Kelsea Ballerini Upends Country Musics Patriarchy on Unapologetically
description: One upside to working in a genre in stagnation is that opportunities to creatively react to it  to underscore its weaknesses, to poke at its norms  abound. For the past several years, country music has been providing such an open playing field, thanks to its fatiguing overreliance on male performers. For a while, these singers specialized in a nearly toxic masculinity that treated women as objects, not subjects. Lately, theyve shifted tactics, preferring a gentlemanly approach that still ultimately reduces women to two dimensions, receiving adoration rather than flirtation.

title: The Democrats and Wall Street
description: To the Editor:

title: A Terrorist Attack in Real America
description: We heard what sounded like a crash and what might have been a gunshot, but it didnt register at first. Lower Manhattan is loud at every hour with traffic and construction, and my wife and I have grown used to ignoring the ambient noise. Even when one police siren follows another. Even when it is followed by dozens more.

title: Ancient Fossil Offers a New European Ancestor to Giraffes
description: A near-perfect fossil unearthed close to Madrid appears to be an ancient European ancestor of giraffes, representing a new species in the family and one that had two sets of bony bumps on its head rather than the single set of modern giraffes.

title: The Last of Joan Rivers
description: Say what you want about Joan Rivers, but she always had impeccable timing.

title: Trump Administration Defends Cuba Embargo at U.N., Reversing Obama

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Thor: Ragnarok
description: The director Taika Waititi narrates a sequence from his film featuring Chris Hemsworth.

title: Fed Lets Interest Rate Stand Ahead of Powell Nomination as Chairman
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve left its benchmark interest rate unchanged on Wednesday and signaled another rate increase is very likely to come in mid-December. But hanging over the meeting was the anticipation of a much bigger change: The nomination of Jerome H. Powell as the next Fed chairman.

title: Growing Up in a World of Fear and Lockdowns

title: Leading Western Publisher Bows to Chinese Censorship
description: BEIJING  One of the worlds largest academic publishers was criticized on Wednesday for bowing to pressure from the Chinese government to block access to hundreds of articles on its Chinese website.

title: Want to See Some Curling? Ticket Sales Tepid for Pyeongchang Olympics
description: When ticket sales were lagging in 2006 before the Winter Games in Turin, Italy, Italian officials explained that the matter was not so much apathy for the Olympics as it was a cultural mind-set.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week

title: Puff, the Magic Mushroom
description: Puffball mushrooms are magical. It seems to take only a light autumn rain to produce one the size of a soccer ball in just a few hours overnight.

title: The Roles of Men and New York State in Womens Suffrage
description: On Nov. 6, 1917, a century ago Monday, signals beamed from The New York Times Tower proclaiming the results of a state constitutional amendment granting women the right to vote.

title: The Storefront Artist Has Nothing to Hide (Except His Identity)
description: For the Brooklyn-born street artist RAE, home for the next month will be a storefront on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. From now until Nov. 22, he will sleep, eat, meet with special guests, make art and watch the people and the traffic stream past, all from a constantly lit window at 130 Allen Street.

description: #SpeakingInDance is a weekly visual exploration of dance on Instagram. Watch the video from our most recent post below, and follow us at@nytimes.

title: Review: Violinist Gidon Kremer Shares 24 Soviet Snapshots
description: The centenary of the Russian Revolution has sparked a flurry of commentary on how and why the Soviet Union was born. On Tuesday the Baryshnikov Arts Center presented a program that reflected on what it was like to be alive inside of it. Subtle and sparse, the hourlong show pairing music by the Soviet composer Mieczyslaw Weinberg with black-and-white images by the Lithuanian photographer Antanas Sutkus delivered a lingering emotional charge.

title: Pariss Best Chocolates: A Guide
description: Ganache, single origin, bean-to-bar, pralins, orangettes, mendiants, palets dor, dark or milk: Craft chocolate in Paris comes in a panoply of forms, flavors, origins and styles. Behind it all are the industry's most revered artisans, many of whom presented their latest innovations at last weekend's Salon du Chocolat, the premier chocolate-lovers festival. Here are 10 of the best.

title: Russia-Financed Ad Linked Clinton and Satan
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers released scores of political ads on Wednesday purchased by Russian agents on Facebook and Twitter that showed the extent of the Kremlins attempts to polarize the American voting public on issues like race, police abuse and religion.

title: These Women Want to Dress You for the Office
description: Despite all that has changed about womens roles in the workplace, what hasnt really changed is their wardrobe. Too many retailers still cater to a corporate world with stuffy pantsuits and shift dresses that wouldnt look out of place next to a fax machine. Happily, a crop of companies founded by entrepreneurial young women (who struggled with this very dilemma) are working on solutions. Here, they share their wisdom on work wear, and where its going next.

title: New York City, South Korea, Duterte: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Bob Dylans Songs for the Soul, Revisited and Redeemed
description: Even in 1979, Bob Dylan could cause a commotion. That was the year he released Slow Train Coming, the album that announced his embrace of Christianity, soon to be followed by Saved in 1980 and Shot of Love in 1981: his born-again trilogy. For those three years, the iconoclast, freethinker and reluctant voice of a generation proclaimed faith in salvation by Jesus Christ (despite his Jewish upbringing), with lyrics that drew a line in the sand. In Precious Angel on Slow Train Coming, he declared, Ya either got faith or ya got unbelief, and there aint no neutral ground.

title: Encountering Robots While Still Using Fax Machines in Japan
description: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Motoko Rich, The Timess Tokyo bureau chief, discussed the tech she's using.

description: Sixteen of The Times most popular instructional cooking videos for Thanksgiving, from spatchcocking a turkey to carving one.

title: I Want Allahu Akbar Back
description: Allahu akbar. Its Arabic for God is greatest. Muslims, an eccentric tribe with over a billion members, say it several times in our five daily prayers. The phrase is also a convenient way to express just the right kind of gratitude in any situation.

title: A University Endowment of Money Made in the Real World
description: Oh the irony. The University of Chicago is getting a $125 million gift from Ken Griffin, the founder of the hedge fund Citadel. The Chicago school of economics, as it is called, leans heavily toward free and efficient markets. Mr. Griffins name and cash  earned in a business that depends on markets being inefficient  will now endow the universitys economics department.

title: Painters Ex-Assistant Charged With Stealing His Works
description: The painter Sean Scully was surprised in early September to receive an email from Bonhams auction house with a photograph of a work attributed to him that they hoped to sell at an upcoming auction. Could the artist confirm certain details about it?

description: Should the Russian Revolution be remembered as one of historys great turning points  or should it be relegated to the dustbin of history given that the new nation it created, the Soviet Union, no longer exists?

title: After the Terror
description: Murderous attacks by a brooding lone wolf attacker or full-blooded terrorist have become, alas, a blight of our times, an eruption of random killing that can strike a cafe, a crowded promenade, a country music festival or a bike path in New York.

title: Park Lane Hotel Draws No Bids Near $1 Billion Price
description: What if they held an auction and nobody bid?

title: Guadagno, Hoping to Succeed Christie, Tries to Escape His Shadow

title: Seven Bizarre Notions Trump and His Team Have About America
description: President Trump, his motley crew of White House and cabinet ideologues, and many other Republicans claim to have a better understanding of American values, traditions and history than the rest of us. They are the real Americans, as the historically illiterate Sarah Palin loved to say many times a day.

title: David Vaughan, Chronicler of Dance History, Dies at 93
description: David Vaughan, a British-born choreographer, critic and performer who was best known for preserving the history of dance through his definitive biographies and painstaking stewardship of the Merce Cunningham archive, died on Friday at his home in Manhattan. He was 93.

description: JERUSALEM  More than a decade after being run out of Gaza by Hamas, the Palestinian Authority on Wednesday took control of the enclaves border crossings, the most tangible sign yet of progress in the deal to end a bitter schism between the groups and ease the territorys suffocating isolation.

description: Some in the Conservative media are calling for the resignation of Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel who recently filed charges in the Trump-Russia investigation.

description: President Trump projected an air of calm on Wednesday after charges against his former campaign chief and a foreign policy aide roiled Washington, insisting to The New York Times that he was not angry at anybody and that investigations into his campaigns links to Russia had not come near him personally.

title: Days Before Vote, Terror Attack Puts Mayor on World Stage

title: Peter Schutz, Executive Who Saved a Signature Porsche, Dies at 87

title: How to Age Well
description: Getting older is inevitable. Here are a few simple ways to keep your body tuned up and your mind tuned in. And the good news is that its never too late to get started.

description: Q. I am a frequent rider of the Grand Central/Times Square shuttle. At both ends of the line there are tracks numbered 1, 3 and 4. What happened to Track 2?

title: Readers Debate What Is, or Isnt, Terrorism
description: Mass killings often touch off anguished discussions about what constitutes terrorism. (Our Interpreter columnists addressed these issues in their most recent column). That was evident in thousands of comments across nytimes.com and on social media in the wake of the deadly rampage Monday in Manhattan, which authorities branded as an act of terrorism.

title: Linda Nochlin, 86, Groundbreaking Feminist Art Historian, Is Dead

title: Review: Thor: Ragnarok, of Gods, Monsters and Silly Jokes
description: Theres a nice bit in Thor: Ragnarok, the latest Marvel blowout to feature the god of thunder, where he tries to start a jet using a voice-activated password. He needs to make a getaway  hes neck deep in trouble and plot entanglements  so identifies himself as the strongest Avenger. No dice. Given his earlier stand-alone movies, Thor might have had better luck cracking the code if hed copped to being the most boring Avenger.

title: Teslas Elon Musk Reassures Investors Over Model 3 Delays
description: A year ago, Teslas chief executive, Elon Musk, pledged to revolutionize auto manufacturing with a major expansion of the companys electric-car factory in Fremont, Calif.

description: The two women spent months adrift at sea and ended up thousands of miles from their destination. Now, new questions suggest that their story may have run off course, too.

title: Volkswagen Sales in U.S. Rebound After Diesel Scandal
description: LANSING, Mich.  There were times last year when Jeff Williams wondered how his Volkswagen dealership was going to bounce back from the diesel-emissions scandal that had rocked the German automaker and badly tarnished its image in the United States.

title: Jane Juska, 84, Who Drew Notice Writing of Late-Life Sex, Dies
description: As Jane Juska  divorced, lonely and 66  watched Eric Rohmers film Autumn Tale in 1999 in a theater in Berkeley, Calif., she was swept up by the story, in which a married woman secretly places a personal advertisement in a newspaper for a widowed friend who believes it is too late for her to find love.

title: Michael Fallon, U.K. Defense Secretary, Quits Over Inappropriate Conduct

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Manhattan Terror Attack Exposes Bike Paths Vulnerable Crossings
description: More than 10 years ago, Eric Ng was struck and killed by a drunken motorist who drove for more than a mile on the bike path of the Hudson River Greenway. He was killed at about the same location where the driver in a terror attack entered the bike path on Tuesday.

title: Thousands of City Children Not Getting Special Education Help

title: Facebook, Under Fire in Russia Inquiry, Posts 79% Rise in Profit
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers sent Facebook a harsh message this  week over how Russian agents used the social network to spread division in the 2016 election. On Wednesday, Facebooks top executives  including its chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, and chief operating officer, Sheryl Sandberg  spread a different message: one of profit.

title: Five Takeaways From the Final New York City Mayoral Debate
description: After spending the day managing the aftermath of a terror attack that left eight dead in Lower Manhattan, Mayor Bill de Blasio had some political business to attend to: the second and final debate of the general election.

description: WASHINGTON  Everyday Advanced Hemp Oil, Bosom Lotion and CBD Edibles Gummie Men may have their fans, but the Food and Drug Administration is not among them.

title: These Are the Ads Russia Bought on Facebook in 2016
description: They made for a wildly varied slide show, designed by Russia to exploit divisions in American society and to tip the 2016 presidential election in favor of Donald J. Trump and against Hillary Clinton. The House Intelligence Committee provided on Wednesday the biggest public platform to date for a sample of the Facebook ads and pages that were linked by a trail of ruble payments to a Russian company with Kremlin ties.

title: Diversity Visa Lottery: Inside the Program That Admitted a Terror Suspect
description: The terrorist attack in New York quickly turned into a debate over immigration policy after President  Trump revealed Wednesday that Sayfullo Saipov, the man accused of killing eight people, had benefited from an obscure program known as the diversity visa lottery.

title: Robert Mueller in the Cross Hairs
description: We may shortly be facing a national crisis. President Trumps base is egging him on to undertake his own Saturday Night Massacre and fire Robert Mueller for committing  for committing  uh, well, for working too hard as a prosecutor.

title: Trump Suggests Guantnamo Prison for Truck Attack Suspect, an Unprecedented Step
description: President Trump said on Wednesday that he was considering sending the terrorism suspect in the truck attack in New York to the wartime prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, an unprecedented step that would raise novel legal questions and likely set off a protest by veteran national security law enforcement officials.

title: Finding a Rootless Life in U.S., Sayfullo Saipov Turned to Radicalism
description: Sayfullo Saipov left home in 2010, just after he celebrated his 22nd birthday and won the lottery to come to America. He never looked back, never again saw his hometown of Tashkent, the capital of Uzbekistan, and never stopped moving.

title: Quotation of the Day: Year of Plotting and a Test Run
description: What New Yorkers showed already is we will not change. We will not be cowed. We will not be thrown off by anything.

title: A Trail of Debt and Minor Charges for Walmart Shooting Suspect
description: THORNTON, Colo.  Scott Allen Ostrem lived alone in a one-bedroom apartment where his neighbors say he cursed at them, and he was often seen carrying a rifle to and from his home. Over the years, he accumulated a trail of minor criminal charges, debts and defunct businesses.

title: Review: In a Double Bill of Physical Comedy, Laughter Is the Best Reflex
description: Lets say youve got a toothache or a crumbling political system and arent in the mood to laugh.

description: When the public mood is a triple-strength cocktail of anxiety and alarm, there is something to be said for theater as comfort food. Heresy, I know  but it can be calming to sit for a while with a sturdily crafted, nicely cast play that was mild even when it was new.

title: Beyonc Joins Disneys Lion King Remake, in a Role Fit for a Queen
description: Beyonc  as close as any modern artist to royalty status in American pop music  will play the queen to be of the Pride Lands in Disneys coming live-action remake of The Lion King.

title: Corrections: November 2, 2017
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A Path to Victory
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Running is an extremely dangerous sport, primarily because it takes place outdoors and involves leaving the safety and comfort of my couch. And yet I do it. Well, what I do could better be described as loping, and only by people a lot more optimistic than me. But I am determined to be a runner, despite the dangers and despite the fact that I wheeze even more than I do when I go curling. Running is addictive and its supposedly good for you, providing you only do it to the point where you remain clinically not dead.

title: Brett Ratner, Prominent Producer, Accused of Sexual Misconduct
description: Brett Ratner, a top producer and director whose films include Rush Hour and The Revenant, is facing allegations from women who said he had sexually harassed or assaulted them over the course of two decades, making him the latest prominent Hollywood figure to be accused of sexual misconduct.

title: While New York Mourns, the President Postures
description: New Yorkers on Wednesday were mourning the eight dead from a terrorist attack in Lower Manhattan and wondering how vulnerable they and their families might be, even as they picked themselves up, as New Yorkers do, and went on with life.

description: HANOI, Vietnam  A Vietnamese businessman named Trinh Xuan Thanh disappeared off the streets of Berlin in July, one day before he had an appointment with German officials to seek political asylum.

title: Choosing a Health Insurance Plan Is Not Shopping
description: Its time to select a health insurance plan for 2018! Whether we get covered through an employer or the Affordable Care Act exchanges, well be told to carefully review our options to find a plan that will give us the best coverage for the least amount of money.

title: Why the Diversity Lottery Needs to End
description: Almost immediately after the Manhattan terrorist attack on Tuesday, President Trump faulted the diversity lottery visa program under which the Uzbek immigrant suspected in the attack entered this country, and laid the blame for the programs existence on Senator Charles Schumer and other Democrats.

description: Revisit the Big Apple in 36 hours and discover the Latino quarters of New York City, from Harlem to Jackson Heights.

title: What Would You Choose to Do If You Had Unlimited Free Time and No Restrictions?
description: What would you do with your time if you did not have to go to school? How would you fill your days, especially if adults placed no restrictions on your choice?
