description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Giants Coach Ben McAdoo did not save his job with a 12-9 overtime victory over the Kansas City Chiefs on Sunday. The Giants record is 2-8, which still qualifies the 2017 season as a disaster.

title: Quandary for Alabama Pastors: What to Say About Roy Moore
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala.  It was a trying week for the people of Alabama, a week of dueling pastoral statements, sinful allegations and claims of religious persecution. And so, on the seventh day, their preachers gave it a rest.

title: Outlander Season 3 Episode 10: How Many Would You Like Me to Save?
description: One of the things Outlander has always done well is to make sure that Claire doesnt have the 20th-century advantage. Time and again, she runs up against how hard it is for her to actually be of any use in the past, even with a modern education. There are so many moving parts that even anticipating the outcome is a gamble. And trying to affect the outcome, more often than not, turns her into a Cassandra. This weeks episode gives Claire one of her most frustrating challenges yet, trapping her at sea on the Porpoise in the midst of a typhoid fever outbreak.

description: Heres what to expect in the week ahead:

title: Behind Mugabes Rapid Fall: A Firing, a Feud and a First Lady
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  The rapid fall of Zimbabwes president, whose legendary guile and ruthlessness helped him outmaneuver countless adversaries over nearly four decades, probably has surprised no one more than Robert Mugabe himself.

title: Border Patrol Agent Killed in Texas in What a Senator Calls an Attack
description: A Border Patrol agent was killed and his partner seriously injured on Sunday morning in an attack in rural West Texas while they were on patrol, according to the federal authorities and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.

description: Now and again a tour bus full of foreigners stops by. Some of them love it. Others will spit their first bite into a tissue.

title: Review: In This Pride and Prejudice, Love Is a Zero-Sum Game
description: Pride and Prejudice at Primary Stages is not your typical Jane Austen dramatization. There are no lavish balls, no sumptuous Regency gowns, few melting glances. Mr. Darcys shirt stays resolutely dry. Which is all to the good; pecs were never really Austens thing. As for the speed and the gags and the dance breaks, well, purists might want to keep some lavender drops handy.

title: The Walking Dead Season 8, Episode 5: A Fruitless Death
description: This seasons war has ushered Negan into a role somewhere between cult leader and military commander, both of which require people skills. Negan has flashed his talents as a public orator time and again, whipping his followers into a bloodthirsty frenzy with speeches delivered in the dramatic, halting cadence of Mussolini. In this weeks episode, he works his powers of persuasion on a more intimate level, and in doing so, he opens himself up a bit as well. But in the sliver of his interior revealed through his candid heart-to-heart with Gabriel, theres only megalomania and delusion.

title: New Trailer: A Wrinkle in Time, From Ava DuVernay
description: Even though Ava DuVernays name isnt seen until the end of the new trailer for her reimagining of A Wrinkle in Time, it clearly exemplifies female empowerment.

description: HOLLYWOOD, Calif.  This interview includes spoilers for Season 1 and the Season 2 premiere of Search Party.

title: Toxic Masculinity Has Slowed Australias March to Same-Sex Marriage
description: When a government official announced on Australian national television on Wednesday that 61.6 percent of participants in a nonbinding nationwide survey had said yes to same-sex marriage, thousands of people gathered in public to celebrate. They hugged, cried and danced to Love Is in the Air. Some rushed to post Instagram photos of themselves holding a Golden Gaytime, a nostalgic Australian ice-cream brand.

title: How Not to Talk to a Child Who Is Overweight
description: I weigh my words (pun intended) every time I address the topic of a childs obesity in the exam room. Yes, I know, you probably want to tell me that I shouldnt use that word  obese  and I promise that I dont. But in the childs electronic medical record, thats the official coding if the childs body mass index is at or above the 95th percentile for age and gender. And medical providers, just like parents, may find themselves walking a difficult line as they try to discuss this fraught subject without increasing the distress that many children are already feeling.

title: What to Read Before Heading to Detroit
description: After decades of decline, largely as a result of the collapse of the auto industry, a bankruptcy settlement has allowed Detroit to begin rebuilding. Here are three books that trace the citys past and present.

Charles Manson, Unhinged Pop Culture Figure
description: Charles Manson, who died on Sunday at 83, has loomed large in American culture ever since a brutal killing spree by his gang of followers, called the Manson family, claimed the lives of the actress Sharon Tate and eight others in the summer of 1969.

description: What do you know about fraternities? What do you know about rituals known as hazing that pledges, or people who hope to be offered an invitation to join a fraternity, must endure?

title: Kenya Court Upholds Presidents Election Win
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Kenyas Supreme Court on Monday dismissed two petitions seeking to overturn last months presidential vote, paving the way for the inauguration of President Uhuru Kenyatta for a second term.

title: In Search of the American Family
description: Every November, mothers, fathers and siblings link arms and tap dance straight into the holiday season. Gathered around the glow of a fireplace or at a packed table for turkey dinner, generations bound by blood, marriage  or even a good Sondheim song  impart wisdom and gifts to their offspring. And every new smile, no matter how different, is greeted with kindness and acceptance.

title: 23 Years for Murder. He Didnt Do it. What Went Wrong?
description: Court documents and sworn affidavits show how the justice system failed 17-year-old Lamonte McIntyre.

title: Exposure Is About Truth, Sure, but Mostly About Power
description: For a town so in love with doomsday scenarios, Hollywood has never been big on revelations about itself. Thats what apocalypse is, literally: disclosure of knowledge. In biblical Greek, apokalypsis means uncovering or unveiling. It refers to the moment when a long-buried truth is finally exposed. The secret could be anything  a plague of worms; corruption; a culture of flagrant harassment, exploitation and abuse. What actually ends the world as we know it is the revelation itself, being shown the thing we had agreed not to see. Once we see that civilization had it coming, we can consign everything to the purifying flames.

title: Preet Bharara Is Not Running for Office
description: You went from being the most famous and powerful United States attorney in the country to hosting a weekly podcast about justice. No offense, but some people might consider that a slight step down. Wow. How much of a descent is that? Look, if I had never become the United States attorney, I would have lived a full and happy and unregretful life. The happiest day of my professional life was becoming an assistant U.S. attorney, because I always wanted to have a position where the only job is to do the right thing. Becoming U.S. attorney was gravy on top of all that. But at some point, youve got to leave.

title: Disrupting the World of Private School With Tech and Guinea Pigs
description: Long dominated by a small group of elite institutions, New York Citys private schools have limited seats, annual tuition approaching $50,000, and an admissions process that can drive even the most levelheaded parents to teeth-grinding anxiety. The schools range in philosophy from traditional to progressive, but in general, they change slowly, if at all.

title: Can I Let My Friend Pay Off My Mortgages?
description: My closest American friend here in Japan, of more than 30 years, is worried about me and wants to pay off my mortgages. He says he doesnt want to be paid back; he just wants to make sure I am out of debt before he dies. He is not dying, but he is 98. He has been mentioning this more and more, and says he wants to write a check the next time we meet. I never talk about this with him unless he brings up the subject. The amount he would give me would come to about 3 percent of his assets. It would have no impact on his financial needs. And frankly, it would be helpful for me.

title: Chinas Revealing Spin on the Sharing Economy
description: For decades after its Communist revolution in 1949, China was known as the kingdom of bicycles. The one-speed Flying Pigeons that swarmed the streets were not simply a cheap mode of transportation. They were symbols of a shared aspiration. Along with a radio, a watch and a sewing machine, a bicycle was one of four possessions  known as sanzhuan yixiang, or three rounds and sound  that urban Chinese families felt they needed to be part of the modern world. By the time I joined the masses in 2001, cycling across Beijing for daily Mandarin classes, cars had begun to displace bicycles. Pedaling alongside my fellow commuters  students, workers, pensioners  I felt part of a communal experience that might soon be gone forever.

title: The Coast Guards Floating Guantnamos
description: On nights when the November rain poured down and he had not slept at all, Jhonny Arcentales had visions of dying, of his body being cast into the dark ocean. He would imagine his wife and their teenage son tossing his clothes into a pit in a cemetery and gathering at the local church for his funeral. It had been more than two months since Arcentales, a 40-year-old fisherman from Ecuadors central coast, left home, telling his wife he would return in five days. A cuff clamped onto his ankle kept him shackled to a cable along the deck of the ship but for the occasional trip, guarded by a sailor, to defecate into a bucket. Most of the time, he couldnt move more than an arms length in either direction without jostling the next shackled man. The sea used to be freedom, he told me. But on the ship, it was the opposite. Like a prison in the open ocean.

title: Serving Extra Years in Prison, and the Courthouse Doors Are Closed
description: WASHINGTON  It is one thing for a new administration to switch sides in a legal dispute. That is merely unusual. It is another to urge the Supreme Court to deny review in a case that would test whether the governments new position is correct.

description: LINCOLN, Neb.  The nearly decade-long battle over Keystone XL has come to symbolize much more than what the disputed pipeline would actually be: a subterranean tube, 36 inches in diameter, carrying crude oil from Canada to Nebraska.

title: Detroit: The Most Exciting City in America?
description: Ive always found the best way to read a citys mood is on a bicycle. You move at a speed that allows for a kind of mutual handshake with the urban topography.

title: Shopping for Holiday Gifts
description: Choosing memorable gifts for family and friends involves more than just checking names off a list. The point is to stop and think about who youre shopping or making something for, said David Stark, a Brooklyn-based event designer who recently conceived a temporary holiday gift shop inspired by the upcoming movie The Greatest Showman at the Manhattan boutique Story. Your gift is an expression of how you think about that person.

title: Jana Novotna, Czech Winner of Wimbledon, Dies at 49
description: Jana Novotna, the Czech tennis star who cried on the Duchess of Kents shoulder after losing a Wimbledon singles final in 1993 and then triumphed at the same tournament five years later, died on Sunday in the Czech Republic. She was 49.

description: Good morning on this cheery-chilly Monday.

title: Clearing Up the Confusion About Salt
description: If youre confused about salt, Im not surprised. Theres been a steady back-and-forth on claims that reducing dietary sodium (which represents 40 percent of the salt molecule) is crucial to our well-being, countered by claims that following this advice can sometimes be a health hazard.

description: Good Monday. Were watching the latest developments in the Justice Department plans to sue to block AT&Ts $85.4 billion bid for Time Warner. (Want this in your own email inbox each morning? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Hunt for Top Indonesian Official in Graft Case Ends at a Hospital Bed
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesian anticorruption officers have arrested the head of the countrys Parliament after a cat-and-mouse saga in which he ignored multiple orders to appear for questioning over a huge graft scandal, disappeared and then resurfaced at a hospital, claiming to have been severely injured in a car accident.

title: Mugabe Ignores Resignation Deadline, Putting Pressure on Parliament
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  Former loyalists of President Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe vowed on Monday to begin impeachment proceedings against him, after he ignored their ultimatum demanding that he step down.

title: Uber Strikes Deal With Volvo to Bring Self-Driving Cars to Its Network
description: SAN FRANCISCO  No one knows what the future of self-driving cars will look like, or how long it will take to get there. But every major player in the field is striking partnerships to be ready for the day when autonomous vehicles finally become mainstream.

title: Remembering Azzedine Alaa: The Designer Who Took Time
description: The last time I saw Azzedine Alaa, the Tunisian-French designer who died this past weekend and was possibly the last of the great couturiers, it was midnight on a Wednesday in October, after the final ready-to-wear shows in Paris, and I had come down to his kitchen to say goodbye.

description: Q. Is it true you can now stop those annoying videos that automatically play on some websites in the Safari browser?

title: Trump Asked China to Free U.C.L.A. Players. What About Activists?
description: President Trump has suggested that he saved three American college basketball players, who had been detained in China for shoplifting, from prison terms as long as a decade.

title: Silent Sub: Time Is the Enemy as Argentina Hunts a Lost Vessel
description: MAR DEL PLATA, Argentina  It was a routine mission to interdict illegal fishing boats off the coast of Patagonia.

title: Facing Second Accuser, Franken Sees His Once-Rising Star Dim
description: WASHINGTON  After making the transition from comedy to politics, Senator Al Franken, Democrat of Minnesota, positioned himself as a staunch defender of womens rights. Sexual harassment and violence are unacceptable, he wrote on Twitter last month. We must all do our part to listen, stand with and support survivors.

title: A Brothel, Repurposed and Restored, Reveals Another Paris
description: PARIS  Off a disheveled street whose questionable past seeps into its dingy present, a garish eruption from a buried era awaits the wary visitor.

title: Kim Jong-un Disciplines North Koreas Top Military Organization
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas leader, Kim Jong-un, is disciplining the leadership of his countrys most powerful military organization, the latest sign of his efforts to tighten his grip on party elites and the armed forces amid a nuclear standoff with the United States, South Koreas main intelligence agency said on Monday.

title: Glenn Thrush, New York Times Reporter, Accused of Sexual Misconduct
description: The New York Times said on Monday that it was suspending Glenn Thrush, one of its most prominent reporters, after he was accused of inappropriate sexual behavior.

title: Skin Cancers Rise, Along With Questionable Treatments
description: John Dalman had been in the waiting room at a Loxahatchee, Fla., dermatology clinic for less than 15 minutes when he turned to his wife and told her they needed to leave. Now.

title: Nathan Peterman? Tom Savage? Who Are All These Starting N.F.L. Quarterbacks?
description: The N.F.L.s marketing strategy is built on its quarterbacks. Commercials featuring Peyton Manning, Aaron Rodgers and Drew Brees seem to run in a loop on Sundays, and a quick scan of the stands reveals a strong bias toward the jerseys of Tom Brady or Cam Newton.

title: New Gene Treatment Effective for Some Leukemia Patients
description: A new way of genetically altering a patients cells to fight cancer has helped desperately ill people with leukemia when every other treatment had failed, researchers reported on Monday in the journal Nature Medicine.

title: Even Her Shopping Trips Require a Chaperone, So She Makes Them Last
description: On a cloudless afternoon, the drapes in Alice Brunns Brooklyn apartment stayed closed. The lone sources of light were shafts of sunshine seeping in and a blinking television screen. That was more than she needed.

title: Just as in 1980, Zimbabwes Celebration May Be Short-Lived
description: By the thousands upon thousands, the people thronged the streets, waving banners, chanting slogans. A long-awaited future was fast approaching their land, Zimbabwe. One name was on all their lips: Robert Mugabe.

title: A 45-Minute Roast Turkey
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.

title: Review: Marvels Runaways, Where the Supervillains are Mom and Dad
description: From Spider-Man to The Gifted, Marvel has a long tradition of cross-pollinating superpowers and teenage angst. Runaways, a comic book series that began in 2003, takes that idea to its logical conclusion: The supervillains that the teenage heroes have to defeat are their own parents.

title: Northern Ireland Is Sinking Into a Profound Crisis
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland  The Northern Ireland Assemblys palatial building in Stormont, in the hills that overlook Belfast, is an eerie place these days.

title: Franken and Trump, Hiding Behind Their Jokes
description: In the 2006 documentary Al Franken: God Spoke, Mr. Franken, the comedian, activist and future senator from Minnesota, offered a quote that would prove prescient for more than its choice of verb: Celebrity trumps ideology.

title: Why the Yankees Are Crowdsourcing Their Manager Vetting Process
description: In professional sports, the search for a new coach or manager is typically done in the shadows, to protect a teams competitive advantage as well as the candidates privacy. Private jets may be dispatched  and even scrambled  to conduct interviews. The chattiest general managers suddenly become taciturn.

title: Trump Returns North Korea to List of State Sponsors of Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Monday officially designated North Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism, a provocative diplomatic move that he said was aimed at drastically increasing pressure on the rogue nation to abandon its pursuit of nuclear weapons.

title: Review: A Peter Pan That Never Takes Flight
description: Even if you do believe in fairies you may not believe in Peter Pan, the Bedlam theater companys downbeat adaptation of the J.M. Barrie original, created and performed by a six-member ensemble. The director, Eric Tucker, specializes in small-cast, big-idea takes on the classics, but this attempt is both a puzzle and a bummer  too childish to tell the story properly and too adult to access its wonder.

title: In Crisis, Angela Merkel Prefers Elections to Minority Rule
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany faced the greatest crisis of her career on Monday after negotiations to form a new government collapsed, shaking a country that is Europes political and economic anchor.

title: A Chefs Life Story? Its Right on This Plate
description: After spending two decades cooking in some of the finest restaurants in New York City and Miami, chef Nina Compton planted new roots in New Orleans in 2015. At Compre Lapin, she now serves dishes that tell her unique story, a blend of her upbringing in St. Lucia, her professional French and Italian cooking influences and local Louisiana ingredients.

title: Starbucks Is Criticized for Its Holiday Cups. Yes, Again.
description: Thanksgiving is right around the corner, which means it is time to embark on a modern American holiday tradition: over-analyzing seasonally available Starbucks cups for signs of liberal nefariousness.

title: Wake Up and Smell the Traffic? London Tries Coffee to Power Buses
description: LONDON  It was part of the imagery of much earlier times: a red double-decker bus nudging through London streets shrouded in smog created in part by its own exhaust fumes.

description: Remember the days when you could just bring a bottle of water from home to the plane? The days before airport security, which allows you to carry liquids only in containers of 3.4 ounces or less?

title: As Chip Makers Consolidate, Marvell Will Buy Cavium in $6 Billion Deal
description: Chip making is increasingly a competition between ever-larger companies, a trend that was highlighted by the announcement on Monday that Marvell would take over Cavium in a $6 billion deal.

description: The secretary general of the United Nations added his voice on Monday to a growing uproar over the reported auctioning of African migrants in Libya as slaves.

title: Review: In Diaspora, an Ancient Siege for the Snapchat Age
description: In Diaspora, a muddle of a play by Nathaniel Sam Shapiro at the Gym at Judson, a group of American Jews on a Birthright trip to Israel drink, hook up and occasionally visit a few historical sights, like Yad Vashem, the museum of the Holocaust, where, as one girl confesses, I dont know, I was kind of turned on, and Masada, the site of an armed resistance that ended in murder and suicide. She gets turned on there, too.

title: Key European Agencies Move to Continent, Signs of Brexits Toll
description: Critical agencies that oversee Europes banks and pharmaceutical sector will move from London to cities on the Continent, political leaders in Brussels decided Monday, potentially ominous harbingers of how Britains impending exit from the European Union could diminish the countrys economic clout.

title: From City Hall to the White House? Eric Garcetti May Try to Defy the Odds
description: LOS ANGELES  There have been governors and generals, senators and members of Congress, secretaries of state and vice presidents. There was even a billionaire business executive chosen as commander in chief.

title: Gerina Piller, Taking Maternity Leave, Vows to Play Again
description: NAPLES, Fla.  The 9-year-old girl waited expectantly for Gerina Piller to emerge from the scoring area after her second round at the L.P.G.A.s Tour Championship on Friday. The young fan, Gianna Clemente, has replayed dozens of times the recording of Pillers eight-foot putt that clinched the United States victory at the 2015 Solheim Cup.

title: Review: A Girls Kerouac Dreams Go Astray in The Mad Ones
description: One thing to be said for The Mad Ones, a musical about a young woman stuck in her car, is that it is highly disciplined in its automotive imagery.

description: WASHINGTON  Janet L. Yellen, chairwoman of the Federal Reserve, said on Monday that she would step down from the Feds board at the same time that she ends her term as chairwoman.

description: LONDON  Queen Elizabeth II, already Britains longest-serving monarch, passed a new milestone on Monday, together with Prince Philip, as they became the longest-married couple of the royal family.

description: Asked to pick a spot for lunch to discuss the new Netflix documentary, Saving Capitalism, a representative for Robert Reich, the former labor secretary, proposed Bobby Vans Steakhouse, across the street from the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Review: The Quietly Cosmic Sound of Desert Stillness
description: Flute Affair was the lighthearted if somewhat misleading title of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centers program on Sunday afternoon at Alice Tully Hall.

title: The Story of Appalachia, With Plenty of Villains
description: The novelist John Knowles (1926-2001) attended Phillips Exeter and Yale, and is the author of A Separate Peace, the quintessential American prep school novel. But he was born in West Virginia. Sometimes his fiction was set there.

title: Every Other Terrible Thing About Roy Moore
description: Before we say goodbye to Roy Moore  Im being optimistic here  lets remember what this is all about. Yes, weve learned that a sizable contingent of voters will favor a sexual predator over a Democrat. But we already knew that from the 2016 presidential election.

title: Online Cocktail-Equipment Shop Opens a Pop-Up
description: For five years, Eric Prum and Josh Williams have sold cocktail equipment, goods for entertaining and clever books online. Now they have opened a bright pop-up boutique. You will find cocktail shakers, bottle openers, bar and cheese knives, items for travel, books and games, little denim napkins and compact ice cube trays. Drink and dessert tastings are scheduled during the run of the shop, through the end of the year: The Kitchen by W&P Design, 171 Elizabeth Street (Spring Street), no phone, wandpdesign.com.

title: When You Need to Impress Your Italian Relatives
description: There is prosciutto, and then there is culatello. To connoisseurs, the latter  cured from a solid chunk of leg, not the whole leg like standard prosciutto  is the variety worth seeking now that the Department of Agriculture has approved for import the culatello di Zibello made near Parma by the Negroni company. For culatello, the meat of black nera di Parma pigs is rubbed with salt, black pepper and garlic, painstakingly tied, wrapped in a pigs bladder and then allowed to cure in cellars. The rosy slices, rounded in shape, have a vein of pinkish fat up the middle. The aroma is ever so lightly funky, the texture is silky and the taste is briny sweet, less delicate than prosciutto di Parma: Culatello di Zibello, $60 a pound, DiPalos Fine Foods, 200 Grand Street (Mott Street), 212-226-1033.

title: An Alpine Cheese for Special Occasions
description: In western Switzerland, Philippe Pasquier  whose company, Le Jeu de Quilles, was established in 1723  still makes his small-batch Gruyre the old-fashioned way, using raw summer milk from cows that forage in the mountains. The system of grazing is called alpage, or transhumance, by which the cattle follow the grasses, herbs and flowers as they develop at increasingly higher altitudes (at least 2,900 feet during the season). The washed-rind cheeses are aged 14 months. This particular Gruyre is now available in the Northeast from FreshDirect. The cheese has a rich, herbal aroma and sweet nuttiness, and texture enhanced with a delicate crystalline crunch, a token of aging. Serve it as is, or use it in scores of recipes: Gruyre dAlpage, $27.99 a pound, freshdirect.com.

title: Paris Hilton Said She Invented the Selfie. We Set Out to Find the Truth.
description: On Sunday, Paris Hilton modestly took partial credit for inventing the selfie.

title: A Connection Beyond Hanukkah Gelt
description: The connection between Jews and chocolate goes beyond Hanukkah gelt. Jewish refugees were instrumental in establishing chocolate companies in America, and before that, they were chocolatiers in France, Austria and other countries. An exhibition of artifacts and other materials sheds light on this history: On Jews and Chocolate, Sundays to Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., to Feb. 25, 2018; Herbert and Eileen Bernard Museum of Judaica, Temple Emanu-El, 1 East 65th Street (Fifth Avenue), 212-744-1400, extension 259, emanuelnyc.org/museum.php.

title: Germany and the Age of Political Absolutism
description: BERLIN  It was the most preposterous mic drop in German history. On Sunday night, after 56 days of four-party talks on forming a coalition government, the pro-business Free Democratic Party abruptly pulled out of the negotiations, effectively ending them.

title: A Rye Whiskey Dressed Up and Ready to Give
description: Sean Josephs, a founder of Maysville in NoMad and Kentons in New Orleans, is a brown-spirits aficionado. He is also a partner in the company behind Pinhook bourbon. The brand has released a smooth, earthy straight rye whiskey, with a finish that channels tarte Tatin. Try it in his El Caballero, a cocktail made for the tapas bar Tia Pol. Measure two ounces of Pinhook rye, a half-ounce each of sweet sherry and Punt e Mes, and two dashes each of Angostura and orange bitters. Mix together with ice until very cold. Strain into a cocktail glass or over a big cube, and garnish with orange peel. The drink is easily expanded to a party-size quantity: Pinhook Straight Rye Whiskey, $37.99 for 750 milliliters, flatiron-wines.com.

title: Fox Establishes Workplace Culture Panel After Harassment Scandal
description: In the aftermath of the sexual harassment scandal at its Fox News division, 21st Century Fox has struck a settlement with a shareholder that is intended to overhaul the workplace culture at the network.

title: Leafy Utensils for Your Leafy Greens
description: Perfect for the autumn table and certainly useful year-round, these teak servers will give salad its due. The servers are 12 inches long, and with their leafy points, theyre excellent for attacking a big bowl of pasta: Maple Leaf Servers, $40, Paper Trail, 6423 Montgomery Street, Rhinebeck, N.Y., 845-876-8050, papertrailrhinebeck.com.

title: A Guide to All Things Thanksgiving
description: A holiday predicated on the concepts of rest, reflection and feasting would seem to be a straightforward undertaking. But holiday traffic, burned side dishes and rarely seen, but opinionated, uncles can all conspire to get in the way of seasonal serenity.

title: The Making of a Family Home in Call Me by Your Name
description: Around three or four years ago, Luca Guadagnino began to look at far-flung properties by the (already small) town of Crema, Italy, where he lived. He phrases the decision in his now-recognizably dreamy way: Id been flirting with the idea of becoming a gentleman of the countryside, says the Italian film director, known for I Am Love and A Bigger Splash.

title: Rock Carvings of Ancient Dogs Getting Taught New Tricks
description: Our bond with dogs is etched in stone.

title: Charles Manson Was Not a Product of the Counterculture
description: The Manson murders  the seven killings committed by Charles Mansons followers in two days in Los Angeles in August 1969  are often thought to mark the end of the 1960s, as if those brutal slayings were the inevitable outgrowth of the counterculture, the dark consequence of long hair, free love, casual drug use and a general breakdown of authority and social norms.

title: Justice Department Sues to Block AT&T-Time Warner Merger
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department sued to block AT&Ts $85.4 billion bid for Time Warner on Monday, setting up a showdown over the first blockbuster acquisition to be considered by the Trump administration and drawing limits on corporate power in the fast-evolving media landscape.

title: Nearly 21 Million Now Receiving AIDS Drugs, U.N. Agency Says
description: Almost 21 million people around the world are now getting life-prolonging AIDS drugs, according to a report issued on Monday. But another 16 million people infected with H.I.V. are not yet on medication.

title: Three Shows to Watch This Week
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.

title: A Helping of Science With Your Thanksgiving Dinner
description: Happy Thanksgiving! Youre about to enjoy one of the most wonderful meals of the year with family and friends. And youre probably looking forward to a plate full of food that you, or someone you care about, spent a lot of time preparing.

title: U.S. Lawsuit Against AT&T and Time Warner
description: A Justice Department lawsuit to block the merger sets up a showdown over the first blockbuster acquisition to come before the Trump administration.

title: Who Is LaToya Cantrell, New Orleanss First Female Mayor?
description: It has been an election season in which women and minorities have won groundbreaking races across the country. And on Saturday, New Orleans continued the trend, electing its first female mayor, LaToya Cantrell, in the citys 300-year history.

title: A Fight on the Bus
U.S. Airstrikes in Afghanistan Take Aim at Taliban Opium Labs
description: WASHINGTON  American and Afghan warplanes conducted a series of strikes on Sunday night at what American officials said were Taliban drug depots, as part of what is expected to be a sustained campaign targeting the groups $200 million-a-year opium trade.
